title: Reading Comprehension Strategies

vocab.definition: The most important part of a story or text
Small pieces of information that tell more about the main idea
To guess what might happen next in a story
To tell the most important parts of a story in your own words

teachingNotes: Teach students to ask questions while reading: Who? What? Where? When? Why? Practice identifying the main idea and supporting details. Use picture books to practice prediction and summarizing skills.

sample.question: What is the main idea of a text?
expectedAny: what the text is mostly about

truefalse.question: The main idea is the most important part of a story.

Summarizing means copying the whole story.

multiplechoice.question: When you guess what might happen next in a story, you are making a:
